NoMoreWrite

A Figma plugin that assists designers in quickly populating text.

Features

Supports data generation for multiple industries

Common information (names, phone numbers, addresses, etc.)

Internet of Things industry (device information, product types, etc.)

Financial information (accounts, transactions, etc.)

E-commerce industry (products, logistics, etc.)

User behaviors (comments, visits, etc.)

Social media accounts (usernames, nicknames, etc.)

Intelligent data generation

Authentic combinations of Chinese names

Phone numbers and ID numbers in proper formats

Reasonable address information

Diverse product names

Convenient operation experience

Categorized display for quick search

Supports batch filling

Supports automatic increment of sequence numbers

New Features

Supports custom text filling

Allows input of multi-line text

Automatic cyclic filling

Supports batch filling within containers

Enhanced data generator

Adds new types of Internet of Things devices

Optimizes the address generation algorithm

Incorporates more social media account types

Version

Current Version: 1.2.0

Usage Instructions

Select the text layer in Figma.

Open the plugin panel.

Choose the required data type.

Click the corresponding button to populate the data.

Update Log

1.2.0

Fixed the module loading issue.

Optimized the error handling mechanism.

1.1.0

Added the custom text filling function.

Enhanced the data generator.

Optimized the user interface.

1.0.0

Initial version released.

Supported data generation for multiple industries.

Optimized the user interface.

Added data of Internet of Things device types.

plugins.name: Radix Colos as figma variables
plugins.description:
Here is the first version of Radix colors as Figma variables. Beta.


Radix Colors - "A gorgeous, accessible color system for user interfaces"


This plugin is a simple way for you to get any of the Radix colors as variables into a variable collection from any of your files.


The plugin allows you to:

  1. add any color to a preferred variable collection
  2. add solid or alpha variants
  3. choose light or dark values for single mode collections
  4. add both light and dark values as modes for multimode collections (Figma paid seat is required for variable modes)
  5. (soon) add a custom color created in radix web ui
  6. set-up a new variable collection with 2 modes
  7. choose your own collection where to put the variables
  8. choose your ow light and dark modes from the collection


INFO: The plugin is functional, but the user guide and error handling are not done yet. I am releasing it as i is for now so everybody can use the current feature set that covers most of the intended feature set


In order for the plugin to function, you need to go to settings and:

  1. select a mode of operation
  2. select or create a variable collection. It can be renamed at any time in the Figma UI
  3. select variable modes where the values will land. (They can also be renamed at any time)


Settings are saved as you select them.

Known bug: When you create a new collection, you need to close and reopen the settings page to reflect the changes, or press the refresh button.


This was mostly developed in coffee shops. I hope you see where i'm going with this... ğŸ˜†


https://www.buymeacoffee.com/bogris
plugins.tagline: add Radix colors as Figma variables intou your collection

plugins.name: Scaffolder
plugins.description:
Scaffolder sets up the pages that are in a project based on a proven formula for small, large and enterprise design systems. You can choose one of 4 options.


Small Project (Design + Style Hints)

Includes pages for mood board, style hints, designs, research, and components. This type is for small projects that don't need a full style guide.


Large Project (Design + Style Guide)

Includes pages for mood board, page types, style guide, designs, research, and components. This type is for large projects that need a full style guide as well as multiple application modules/areas.


Enterprise Project (Design)

Includes pages for designs and research. This type is for enterprise projects that not only needs a style guide, but also needs to separate the design system, guide, and components from the page designs. This is meant to be used along with the 'Enterprise Project (Theme)' type.


Enterprise Project (Theme)

Includes pages for mood board, page types, style guide, and components. This type is used to build out the style guide, design system, and components that will be used with the 'Enterprise Project (Design)' file.


Note: Once you run the plugin, do not run it again or you might get duplicate pages. It will not remove existing pages except for the initial, default page.
plugins.tagline: Scaffolds project page setup for quick, consistent design file.

plugins.name: ChromaCraft
plugins.description: This Figma plugin allows users to select a single element on the canvas. It analyzes the color of the selected element and determines whether it's a light or dark color. Based on this analysis, it generates a new color that is either darker or lighter and creates a visual representation of this new color beside the selected element. The plugin also takes care of font loading and positioning the new color representation appropriately.
plugins.tagline: ColorShift: Enhance with Dynamic Color Combinations

plugins.name: Batch rename variables
plugins.description:
Renaming variables at scale can be pretty tricky, or nearly impossible!


This plugin will allow you to do so by using either:

  1. Find and replace
  2. Add a prefix
  3. Add a suffix
  4. Change the casing for all


If you make a mistake, you can revert the change too.

plugins.name: Automator: Automate hundreds of creatives instantly.
plugins.description:
Want to create hundreds of creatives instantly? Well now you can!


Introducing Automator, a plugin built to make executing multiple creatives quick and easy.


How does it work?

Automator takes your existing creatives within Figma and applies data to that creative from a spreadsheet. You can simply drag your spreadsheet of data into Automator and it will convert that data into creatives. The only thing you need to do is make sure that your item names match the headers in your spreadsheet. The data can consist of text and images (note that images need to be served from a URL).


For best results make sure that you have you prepared your 'template' creatives in a way that work best for your data. Make sure that your text boxes are sized in a way that the new text can fit, such as keeping the box boundaries within the creative space. Automator automatically resizes the text to fit the text box, so keep that in mind when it comes to text that you don't want to be larger than a button or text that goes over an focal point of an image.
plugins.tagline: Automate hundreds of creatives instantly.

Make sure that your text boxes are sized in a way that the new text can fit, such as keeping the box boundaries within the creative space. Automator automatically resizes the text to fit the text box, so keep that in mind when it comes to text that you don't want to be larger than a button or text that goes over an focal point of an image.

plugins.name: Source DS Utils
plugins.description:
Bunch of utilities for Source Design System and Source Foundation plugin. I feel like these automations can be useful for everyone who designs in Figma.


This is a UI-less plugin that uses Figma quick actions to run automations.


Export component templates

Select components or frames with components and run the command to copy all these components as frames. You can use these copies to import component templates back.


Import component templates

Select a frame with exported component templates and run the command. This command will either replace target component content with the contents of the template or it will merge layers


Fix layers

Sometimes Figma does not resize absolutely positioned layers when you update something rapidly. When you spot such rouge layers went off you can fix them with this automation.


This command finds all absolutely positioned layers inside auto layout frames and snaps their size back to fit the parent.


Create color Styles

This command will create colour styles that are bound to the variables of the same name.


Clone component

Effortlessly clone any component or component set. When you copy/paste a simple component with lots of properties Figma creates a component instance. This automation creates an identical copy with all the properties available.


Make local component

Simplify workflow for slot components. This automation takes the instance inside another component, creates a local copy of that instance, makes it a component and swaps it with that component.


Slot to local component

Simplify workflow for slot components. This automation takes the instance, checks instance swap properties and enables you to swap it with newly created component. Lear more here -> https://forum.figma.com/t/slot-component-workflow-plugin/93749


Update Elevation Components

This is Source Design System specific automation. It reads effect styles and updates custom-made elevation components to match effect shadows.


Set Playground

Mark any file as Source Foundation Playground. This plugin uses figma.root.setPluginData method from plugin API to toggle 'SDSPlayground' property.
plugins.tagline: Automations for Source Design system

plugins.name: I18n exporter
plugins.description:
Tabbed JSON Viewer for Figma


Transform your text variables into JSON format required by i18n libraries for language translations directly within Figma!


How It Works

Prepare Your Variables: Ensure your variable collections are correctly named i18n in Figma. This is crucial for the plugin to identify and process the variables meant for internationalization.


Fetch Variables: Click on the Get Variables button to automatically fetch and transform your project's i18n variables into a structured JSON format.


View and Copy: The plugin conveniently displays your variables in a tabbed interface, organized by language. Simply select the desired language tab to view the JSON output. Use the copy button to copy the JSON to your clipboard for easy integration into your i18n workflow.


Clear JSON: Want to start over or clean up? Click Clear JSON to reset the output area.


Features

Easy-to-use Interface: A user-friendly UI with a tabbed display allows for seamless navigation and operation.

Efficient Variable Conversion: Quickly converts your Figma text variables into i18n-compatible JSON.

Flexible Copy Options: Copy individual languages or the entire JSON output with a single click.


Getting Started

To get started, ensure your variable collections within Figma are named i18n. This naming convention is essential for the plugin to recognize and process your text variables for translation. Once set up, click on the Get Variables button to convert and view your variables in JSON format.


Whether you're developing multilingual designs or working on international projects, this plugin simplifies the translation process by seamlessly integrating with your i18n libraries.


Enhance your design workflow and embrace global accessibility with the Tabbed JSON Viewer for Figma.


Note: This plugin is an independent tool designed to facilitate the conversion of text variables to JSON for i18n libraries. It is not an official i18n plugin or affiliated with any official i18n library developers.
plugins.tagline: I18n exporter

plugins.name: Figma to PostGrid
plugins.description:
Figma to PostGrid


The Figma to PostGrid Plugin is built for designers and developers, letting you easily export your Figma designs into ready-to-use PostGrid templates. This means you can leverage the power of Figma's design tools to create stunning and personalized direct mail pieces, all without leaving Figma.


What can you do with the Plugin?


  1. Works great with how you already design: No need to make major shifts within your systems, tools and tech stacks, the plugin works seamlessly with your existing design workflow!
  2. One-click export: Export your beautiful designs directly into PostGrid with just a few clicks.
  3. Make it yours: Use merge variables to add personalized information to each piece of mail, making it unique.
  4. Ditch the PDFs: Forget about static PDFs and create mailers that are more engaging and interactive.


How to get started


  1. Open the plugin in your Figma workspace.
  2. Sign in using your PostGrid account credentials or add the test/live API key.
  3. Click on "Create Template" to add the supported template and create the collateral from scratch.
  4. Click on "Export Template" once you are ready with the collateral design.


Access the detailed guide to help you get started.


Reach out to support@postgrid.com if you have any questions or issues.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly convert Figma designs into dynamic PostGrid direct mail templates.

plugins.name: Filla - Color Palette Extractor
plugins.description:

Filla dives through every nested layer; shapes, text, vectors, icons, and pulls out every unique solid and gradient fill or stroke. It then drops those colours into a neat swatch grid on-canvas, each labelled with its HEX value. One click turns the whole set into named Figma Color Styles.


How to use:

1. Select any parent frame, component, or section.

2. Run Filla â†’ watch the deep scan.

3. Review the generated palette.

4. Hit Create Styles to add them to your library.


Why itâ€™s handy

â€¢ Kick-start a design system by surfacing legacy colours.

â€¢ Audit messy files and spot duplicates fast.

â€¢ Hand off a clear colour spec to developers in seconds.

plugins.name: ComfyUI-Image-Generator-Advance
plugins.description:
ComfyUI Image Generator Advance

Seamlessly Integrate Any ComfyUI Workflow

Powered by Comfy Deploy, this plugin bridges Figma with limitless AI workflows. Unleash unparalleled freedom to connect Figma and AIâ€”customize, innovate, and create without boundaries!


---


Features

Unlock ComfyUIâ€™s Full Potential:

Every feature ComfyUI offers is at your fingertips. If you can build it in ComfyUI, you can integrate it with Figma for AI-powered image generation!

Endless Customization:

Turn complex workflows into streamlined Figma actions.


---


Quick Start Guide

  1. Registeron: deploy.comfyui.asia
  2. Install the comfyui-deploy plugin in ComfyUI and configure your workflow . see tutorial.
  3. Deploy your workflow on deploy.comfyui.asia , configure GPU settings (you can use your own GPU), and obtain your API key.
  4. Launch the ComfyUI Image Generator Advance plugin in Figma, enter your API key, and start generatingâ€”your custom workflow parameters will auto-load!


FAQ


Q: Is this plugin free?

A: We offer affordable paid plans to cover server costs and future upgrades. Your support keeps the innovation alive! ğŸ’¡


Q: Why are generated images downscaled?

A: To ensure smooth data transfer and avoid bottlenecks, images are temporarily resized to a max of 1536 px on the longest edge. For full resolution, use upscaling workflows after initial processing.


Q: Why do requests sometimes fail?

A: ComfyUIâ€™s API is still evolving. Check your browser console for errors, refresh the plugin, or retry the task. Ensure stable internetâ€”**VPN required for users in mainland China**.


Q: Are servers located in China?

A: No. Due to AI regulations and licensing complexities, servers are hosted overseas. Users in China may experience slight latency; a stable VPN connection is recommended.

plugins.name: Perceptually Uniform Gradients
plugins.description:
By default, Figma can generate some gradients that get really muddy as they transition from color to color. With this plugin you can generate gradients using color models which handle interpolation better, which translates to more beautiful gradients.


Features:

  1. Generate gradients in Lab, OKLCH, or LCH and insert them into your Figma files as a continuous gradient or as individual, evenly-spaced stops
  2. Extract key colors from your current selection
  3. Copy raw text color scales out of the plugin in JSON format
  4. Generate multi-hue gradients
  5. Automatically correct the lightness distributions of your gradients
  6. Generate bezier-curved gradients in the Lab color space
  7. Adjust the gamma distribution of your gradients
  8. Select colors from a curated library of options
  9. Drag and drop to reorder colors
plugins.tagline: Generate more beautiful gradients by interpolating them with perceptually uniform color models.

plugins.name: Nested Instances
plugins.description:
This tool shows you any instances within the current selection.

Why is the useful? If you have a lot of similar layers with nested instances it's not easy to update them all simultaneously. Figmas new select similar tool solves some of these problems but this plugin is a lot more explicit with it's functionality.


In addition to instances, this also shows any layers with the same name in the current selection which can be useful for editing similar layers.

plugins.name: TokenKebab Converter
plugins.description:
Purpose

This Figma plugin is designed to facilitate a smoother transition between design and development stages, particularly for those utilizing the Tokens Studio and EightShapes in their design system workflow.

Key Functionality

  • Typography Token Transformation:
  • Converts typography tokens defined in dot notation (e.g., typography.Body.Bold) into an appropriate Sass mixin structure (e.g., @include fontStyle(body-bold);).
  • Kebab-Case Conversion:
  • Transforms tokens, including those related to spacing (e.g., spacing.150), into a kebab-case format, ensuring consistency and CSS-friendly naming conventions (e.g., spacing-150).
  • Theme Prefixing:
  • Automatically prefixes theme-related tokens with "light-", changing, for instance, theme.input.border.default to light-theme-input-border-default.

In essence, the plugin programmatically refactors design tokens, enhancing their usability and implementability in CSS/Sass codebases, and ensuring a coherent and systematic naming convention throughout the design-to-development handoff process.
plugins.tagline: Ensuring Consistency from Design Tokens to Implementation

plugins.name: Luckino - Variables Import/Export JSON & CSS
plugins.description:
This plugin helps bridge the gap between Figma Variables and your design system implementation by allowing you to:



Import design tokens:


Import design tokens from W3C-compatible JSON format into Figma Variables

Preview tokens before importing to validate structure and values

Seamlessly map token values to the appropriate variable types

Support for color, number, and alias references


Export as standard formats:


Export Figma Variables to JSON following the W3C Design Tokens format

Generate CSS variables for immediate use in web development

Maintain references between variables during import/export

Filter by collections, modes, and variable types


Perfect for design system teams who want to keep Figma Variables in sync with their codebase, allowing designers and developers to work with the same source of truth.
plugins.tagline: Import and export design tokens between Figma Variables and standard formats like JSON and CSS.

plugins.name: Component Swapper
plugins.description:
Replaces the selected objects with similarly named objects from the library.


For example, if you need to replace one icon set with another. Works within any selected object including components.


The objects should differ by the beginning of their names, while the rest of the name should remain the same.

For example: a_icon â†’ b_icon or filled_icon â†’ outlined_icon.


To use it, you need to:

  1. Enter the library ID in the settings (âš™ï¸)
  2. Enter your access token
  3. Enter a name fragment of the objects to be replaced and a fragment of the new objects' names
  4. Select the objects you want to replace and run the plugin


How to find the library ID

In your library, click Share and copy the link.

The library ID is the part that comes after /design/ in the URL:

www.figma.com/design/{file-id}/unnecessary_part_of_the_link


How to find the access token

Read the article in Figmaâ€™s documentation
plugins.tagline: Replaces the selected objects with similarly named objects from the library

plugins.name: Color Analyzer
plugins.description:
Color Analyzer is an intuitive Figma plugin that provides in-depth analysis of colors in your designs. Once you select an element, the plugin generates a square representing the analyzed color alongside comprehensive information:


Displays color values in HEX, RGB, and CMYK formats

Automatically calculates and shows contrast ratios against white (#FFF) and black (#000) backgrounds

Presents results in a clear, easy-to-read format next to the analyzed element


With Color Analyzer, you can quickly check WCAG accessibility compliance, optimize text readability, and ensure color consistency across your designs. Perfect for UI/UX designers who care about details and accessibility in their interfaces.
plugins.tagline: Detailed color analysis with HEX, RGB, CMYK values and contrast ratios for accessibility.

Presents results in a clear, easy-to-read format next to the analyzed element


With Color Analyzer, you can quickly check WCAG accessibility compliance, optimize text readability, and ensure color consistency across your designs. Perfect for UI/UX designers who care about details and accessibility in their interfaces.
126884.tagline: Detailed color analysis with HEX, RGB, CMYK values and contrast ratios for accessibility.

plugins.name: Typography Inspector
plugins.description: Typography Inspector helps you quickly analyze and manage text styles in your Figma designs. Select any frame, component, or group, and the plugin will display font details like typeface, size, weight, line height, and letter spacing. It also groups similar text styles for easy bulk selection and editing. Perfect for designers who want to maintain consistent typography across projects!
